name: Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Zaandam

reviews.text: My stay at the Inntel Hotel in Zaandam was for business purposes. The rooms were modern and spacious and the meeting rooms were much the same. The location was excellent, and was a very quick and easy train ride from the airport. The hotel is basically at the door step of the train station and is quaintly located, with lots of shops and restaurants near by.
reviews.title: Excellent location, great facility!

reviews.text: Was looking for an hotel near amsterdam but not far away, and by surprise i found this one, and reason I chose it was because the design of the hotel, as building structure and looks can just surprising and impressive. Price was very good as well, and really modern. I have to say that we found lot of people eating at the restaurant, which was not our plan, but we tried and is not such bad, quality is good. Parking is closed to the hotel, a public parking on a shopping center, not expensive for dutch standards and discount applied by the hotel makes it less a pain, but on the neighbourhood you can find night parking as well, in an acceptable walking distance. Hotel room is very good, at any type. Have been several times and been on different ones, those with bath and inroom sauna are great, big space, lighting good, and each room has different decoration, which you can see at the entrance door of each room, original must say. Beds are extremely confortable so overall,i will recommend this hotel for business or holidays with modern style choice and good price for value.
reviews.title: Nice surprise

reviews.text: Clean hotel, new instalations, good staff, very beautiful and perfect location next to the train station. great breakfast, not included in the price and quite expensive however very good quality and variety.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: the hotel was as beautiful, if not more, as the photo shows. it is just right outside the train station. the view was marvellous and the room was great too. the restaurant inside the hotel was amazing as well. i love it but i only stayed for a night because the town was so small and there was nothing much to do.
reviews.title: amazing
I expected more - disappointing
reviews.text: I picked this because I thought it would be a wacky different hotel with boutique style - and in part it was, but in several ways it was disappointing. It looks very different and impressive from outside but several issues frustrated me. Firstly, having gone in to ask where the hotel car park was, we parked up and walked up to the hotel and casually I thought I'd check we could get out early in the morning (ready for the markets we planned to visit) to find it was 7am to 11pm only. Having travelled all day I didn't feel energised enough to drive around looking for another car park. We then got to the room to find we were looking out at the side of a rooftop 10m away - so no decent view. Hell, I thought, they offer a spa and massage, let me get a back rub at least. 4 calls later they explained that they couldn't do this in the next few hours, so that didn't work. At least I could catch up on my emails.... Oh no I couldn't, I just could not connect to what looked like a good wifi signal. I called reception who advised I disable the firewall on my iPad... I didn't think iPad's had firewalls so I thought I'd google that... oops, no wifi of course. I put my shoes back on, went down to reception and said, go on then, how do I do that? They accepted it was probably a router issue so they'd reset it and try again. But no luck. So I sat in the noisy bar and bought beer and tried to work.
We stayed at the Golden Tulip for 2 nights. It was easy to get to via train from the airport as soon as you come off the train its only a two minute walk into the hotel.
reviews.title: Out of town location but just 2 minutes from train station and bus station

reviews.text: The hotel is located behind a busy main road(not noisey) and the local town centre Zaandam which has a good range of shops and resturants. but this did not cause any problems. The only downfall is that the distance and time that it takes you to get into Central Amsterdam; 25 mins on the bus or 20 mins on the train. You can purchase a bus ticket for under 7 euros which you can use over 3 times depending on distance of your journey. For convience it would be better to stay in central amsterdam.
reviews.title: Ok hotel bad location

reviews.text: The hotel staff were very helpful and pleasent and there was always someone on call. The rooms were tastfully decorated and clean, but we did have to ask for more clean towels.
reviews.title: Great BUSINESS hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel has only 1 computer connected to the internet which everyone likes to use (if they can) so if you are wanting to find out about local tourist info just go into town.
reviews.title: Great Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and we had a wonderful time. The Hotel was out of this World, staff were friendly, the food in the Hotel restaurant was delicious, along with one of best fillet steaks I have ever eaten. We did not have breakfast at the Hotel, however, on walking past in the mornings, the breakfast looked very appetizing. We stayed in the Craft Room Deluxe, which was very spacious, had a king-size bed and a great view over Zaandam. The rooms were spotlessly clean which is something that other hotels lack. We also used the pool and sauna which was nice to be able to unwind after a long day in the City. With the train station so close, it was a 15 minute train journey to Schiphol and 10 minute journey to Amsterdam. We will be returning to this Hotel for another short break very soon, really impressed.
reviews.title: Fantastic!
Excellent Super Friendly Hotel
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights eating breakfast in the hotel on 1 morning and having an evening meal once. Room was clean and modern, spacious and well lit, and the temperature was easy to control. Food was nice and the bar was well stocked. The bar closes at 12AM for residents.
Hotel is ideally located. Local bars and restaurants are close by and the train station is a stones throw away.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I used this hotel for a visit with my 4 year old daughter. As I do not live in the Netherlands, the location was perfect when traveling into Schiphol Airport. There is plenty of shopping just steps away from the front door. The service was excellent and everyone was very helpful. The room was a bit odd but clean. It was more boutique than a standard room, which was nice. My daughter really loved the pool. Will be staying again for sure.
reviews.title: Impressive outlook

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hubby and I were attracted by the design of this hotel, so we gave it a try when we visited the Netherlands around May 2012. It was easily accessible, just next to the train station. The staff were friendly and the room was OK.
reviews.title: funky hotel £4 and 15mins from Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were initially drawn to staying here based on the hotel's unique design. Pictures do not do this property justice, you have to see it in person to believe it, and appreciate it.
reviews.title: Modern, Quiet Hotel with Convenient Access to Transit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent one night here before moving on to another hotel in Amsterdam, and I wish we had stayed longer. The staff, the room, and the location were all wonderful. The Inntel is steps away from the Zaandam train station, at one end of the quaint town's shopping and restaurant mall. A canal divides both sides of the mall containing various retail shops, banks, and restaurants. It's a quiet, and quaint hamlet, a short train ride from the historic hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were warmly greeted and quickly checked in to our room. A $50 deposit was placed on the credit card, for incidentals and meals. We were refunded a portion of the deposit, since we chose to eat at their buffet breakfast on the morning of our departure.
reviews.title: Excellent choice. Best hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are themed to products unique to Dutch culture. Our fifth floor room was dedicated to "Moestard Poeder", or Mustard Powder. A large, old fashioned Moestard Poeder advertisement hung on the wall at the head of the bed. A smaller advertisement was affixed to the room door and just inside the room.
reviews.title: New and nice hotel

reviews.text: The room was on the small side, compared to other hotel rooms I've stayed in. Two single beds were pushed together to serve as a double bed. The mattresses, pillows, and bed linens were clean and comfortable. Our room did not have the best of views. I opened the vertical shades to a view of the hotel's clay tile pitched roof, and the clock on the tower of the Zaandam train station. A small, flat screen TV provided the entertainment consisting mainly of Dutch language TV channels, though CNN International was also available. The bathroom was clean and modern. The shower was a bit of a challenge to operate, but once you got the hang of it, there was adequate water pressure and excellent temperature control. There was a half "door" on the shower side of the tub/shower unit, and if the shower wasn't aimed just so, you'd end up with a lot of water on the floor. Be sure to aim the shower downward! This environmentally conscious hotel utilizes a system where you insert your room card in a slot just inside the doorway to turn on the lights and power outlets. I thought I was charging my cell phone while we were away from the room and when I returned, I realized my phone hadn't charged, because I took the room key with me and the room's power was turned off.
reviews.title: hotel review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife took a day off for ourselves and dumped the kids at family. We took the Junior founder suite.
reviews.title: Luxurious feeling!

reviews.text: This had a beautiful view on the Zaandam landscape. As I am from Zaandam, I loved it. The room has a sauna, waterfall shower and whirlpool. The bed was king size and of high quality. Everything is top quality and well designed. The rooms are very clean as well. The hotel has a small swimmingpool which is nothing special. The sports area is also nothing impressive.
reviews.title: Nice and funky hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good. An huge buffet with too much to choose from. I did not choose to diner there as there are a lot of nice places close by. The location is in the middle of the city and next to the train/bus station (as well as taxi).
reviews.title: What a great hotel

reviews.text: The price was a bit high, but considering the quality and location ( 15 minutes with train to Amsterdam Central), it is a reasonable price. The staff is very professional, which is an absolute plus.
reviews.title: Old Zaan Style Hotel, but modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel off the path

aka: Inntel Hotel Amsterdam Zaandam North Holland
description: Unique and famousThis 4 star hotel with its world renowned look is situated next to the Zaandam train station, where the train will take you to the centre of Amsterdam within 12 minutes. Also, the RAI Congress Centre and Schiphol Airport are easy to reach by train. Inntel Hotels Amsterdam Zaandam has 160 unique hotel rooms, a Wellness Club, free wifi internet and it's own Tourist Information Office.
